item.title: By: Jerry
item.dc:creator: Jerry
item.description: Is there a way to show daily events in order of time instead of alphabetically?
item.content:encoded: Is there a way to show daily events in order of time instead of alphabetically?

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/community-events/comment-page-1/#comment-23280">Jerry</a>.
I see. I missed that. You will need to make some changes to the stylesheet as some of the default colors don't work well with your site colors.
To change the black background of the odd lines, go to the Stylesheet section under Community Events, look for .community-events-odd and change the background-color property to something other than #000000, which is the color black. I assume you are familiar with web hex colors? Once changes, save the stylesheet and you should see the change.
Let me know if you need any more guidance changing colors. Some of the properties, like text shadows, are coming in from your site theme, but can be overridden if you so desire.
If you enjoy Community Events, please consider supporting its development.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jerry.

I see. I missed that. You will need to make some changes to the stylesheet as some of the default colors don’t work well with your site colors.

To change the black background of the odd lines, go to the Stylesheet section under Community Events, look for .community-events-odd and change the background-color property to something other than #000000, which is the color black. I assume you are familiar with web hex colors? Once changes, save the stylesheet and you should see the change.

Let me know if you need any more guidance changing colors. Some of the properties, like text shadows, are coming in from your site theme, but can be overridden if you so desire.

If you enjoy Community Events, please consider supporting its development.

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/community-events/comment-page-1/#comment-23278">Jerry</a>.
Hi Jerry. Why just the thank you. Did you figure it out based on my suggestion that it might be a stylesheet conflict? I looked at the URL of the site you entered in your comment and cannot find the Community Events calendar. Is it on a hidden page?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jerry.

Hi Jerry. Why just the thank you. Did you figure it out based on my suggestion that it might be a stylesheet conflict? I looked at the URL of the site you entered in your comment and cannot find the Community Events calendar. Is it on a hidden page?

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/community-events/comment-page-1/#comment-23275">Jerry</a>.
Hi Jerry, can you give me the address of the page where you are trying to set this up? It may be that some of the styles defined in your site stylesheet are conflicting with the ones defined in Community Events.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jerry.

Hi Jerry, can you give me the address of the page where you are trying to set this up? It may be that some of the styles defined in your site stylesheet are conflicting with the ones defined in Community Events.

item.title: By: Jerry
item.dc:creator: Jerry
item.description: I downloaded Community Events last night to see if it is what I am looking for the site I manage. The problem I am having is every other day shows in black and events can't be seen. Is there a way to fix this?
item.content:encoded: I downloaded Community Events last night to see if it is what I am looking for the site I manage. The problem I am having is every other day shows in black and events can’t be seen. Is there a way to fix this?
